title: I found a way to get out of supporting
body: If I'm later in the pick, I'll just say "I can support Bard too if I don't get X." Half the time someone says "No, it's ok. I'll support, you go X." It works better than taking Clarity/Revive used to.

Sion needs his food to get tanky, so support is only good for so long.

well ye. Still, I got 450+ HP from 61 creeps and 3 kills and 7 assists.

He is actually not much great in Jungle because he is pretty much Ulti dependant and we all know how *easy* is to land that ultimate.

Later in the game you can still clear waves if no one else will reset a lane, getting you more stacks. Also, if you are actually getting assists that is 10 health per assist. Which in turn got me over 200 health from assists alone in one game.

Sion support can clear waves easily because he builds full tank 90% as a top laner anyways. He can definitely get himself some farm and can also function as a bit of an anti-siege support

Besides, Sion gets HP with more assists as well. Yes Sion's much stronger in top lane or the jungle, but as a non-traditional support, Sion is a beast, he crushes popular soloQ supports like Thresh, Leona, and Blitzcrank and can 1v1 most of the meta ADC's as well in the early-mid game. Even if he dies, he can throw on shields on his teammates as he beats the enemy down in his passive

The only flaw of Sion support is the same issue with all soloq supports...people get cocky when they're ahead, they throw games, and then blame it on the support, especially when the support is a non-traditional one.
